intro: Coelospermum decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive coelospermum, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsules as its fruit, containing numerous small seeds.
